thread.title: Davis Gaines will return to Orlando Shakes for 2017-18 season
thread.title_full: Davis Gaines will return to Orlando Shakes for 2017-18 season

author: Matthew J. Palm
title: Davis Gaines will return to Orlando Shakes for 2017-18 season
text:
John Updike ’s bestselling novel “Gertrude and Claudius” for the stage. The new play will be read this fall at the Shakes’ annual PlayFest and then will receive a world-premiere staging at the theater in 2019.
“Gertrude... 
Orlando Shakespeare Theater has commissioned playwright Mark St. Germain to adapt John Updike ’s bestselling novel “Gertrude and Claudius” for the stage. The new play will be read this fall at the Shakes’ annual PlayFest and then will receive a world-premiere staging at the theater in 2019. 
“Gertrude... (Matthew J. Palm) “Native Gardens,” Jan. 3-Feb. 4, 2018: Neighboring couples — one white, one Latino — disagree over their property line in this new comedy from Karen Zacarias, who also wrote “Legacy of Light” and “Chasing George Washington,” both of which have been produced locally. “Native Gardens,” which was read at the Shakes’ PlayFest in 2016, uses humor to raise issues of class, race and privilege. Caption Dr. Phillips Center's second phase to break ground next month 
The long-awaited second phase of the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts is set to break ground March 6, putting the venue’s third theater on track for a May 2020 debut. 
The long-awaited second phase of the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts is set to break ground March 6, putting the venue’s third theater on track for a May 2020 debut. Caption Dr. Phillips Center's second phase to break ground next month 
The long-awaited second phase of the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts is set to break ground March 6, putting the venue’s third theater on track for a May 2020 debut. 
The long-awaited second phase of the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts is set to break ground March 6, putting the venue’s third theater on track for a May 2020 debut. Caption Bach Festival's 'Spiritual Spaces' 
Artistic director John Sinclair talks about 'Spiritual Spaces,' a new program at this year's Bach Festival. 
Artistic director John Sinclair talks about 'Spiritual Spaces,' a new program at this year's Bach Festival. Caption The Morse Museum celebrates its 75th anniversary 
Revered around the world for its Louis Comfort Tiffany collection, the Morse Museum is celebrating its 75th anniversary. 
Revered around the world for its Louis Comfort Tiffany collection, the Morse Museum is celebrating its 75th anniversary. Caption Honolulu mural artist bringing ’heavenly light’ to Florida Hospital 
Renowned mural artist Andrew Rose, from Honolulu, Hawaii, works on his latest project: a massive, 3-story mural entitled "Light," at Florida Hospital for Women, in Orlando, January 23, 2017. (Joe Burbank/Orlando Sentinel) 
Renowned mural artist Andrew Rose, from Honolulu, Hawaii, works on his latest project: a massive, 3-story mural entitled "Light," at Florida Hospital for Women, in Orlando, January 23, 2017. (Joe Burbank/Orlando Sentinel) Caption Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts Center 2017-2018 broadway season 
The 2017-2018 Broadway Season line-up for the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts. 
The 2017-2018 Broadway Season line-up for the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts. “Shakespeare in Love,” Feb. 7-March 25, 2018: The romance is based on the 1999 Oscar-winning film that starred Joseph Fiennes and Gwyneth Paltrow . In the story, young Will has a case of writer’s block. Can smart and beautiful Viola inspire him? “ Twelfth Night,” Feb. 21-March 23, 2018: Shakespeare’s comedy of shipwrecked twins, mistaken identity and unlikely love takes the stage. The Shakes’ production will be Elizabethan in style, with an all-male cast and dialogue, costumes, scenery, music and dance appropriate for 1602, when the play was written. “ Timon of Athens,” March 28-April 29, 2018: An all-female cast will tell Shakespeare’s story of wealthy Timon, who loses a fortune — and fair-weather friends. 
Children’s shows include “Aladdin and the Magic Lamp” (June 15-July 23), the story of a boy, a genie and magical wishes; “Showtime for Shakespeare” (Oct. 19-Nov. 17), based on a Mary Pope Osborne “Magic Tree House” book; and a stage adaptatation of children’s story “Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day” (April 5-May 5, 2018). 
PlayFest, the theater’s reading series of new works, is scheduled to return Nov. 2-5. For more information on the theater, located at the Lowndes Shakespeare Center, 812 E. Rollins St., Orlando, call 407-447-1700 or go to orlandoshakes.org . 
mpalm@orlandosentinel.com
